Commerce & Banking (U.G)

Commerce is the conduct of trade among economic agents. Generally, commerce refers to the exchange of goods, services, or something of value, between businesses or entities.

Commerce & Banking (U.G)​

Commerce is a popular stream among HSC (10+2) students in India. Having studied Commerce in Class 11th-12th allows candidates to choose from a multitude of courses at graduation level, paving the way for a range of career choices. One of the major benefits that Commerce students have over Arts students is that they are eligible for both Commerce and Arts courses. In this article, you will read all about course selection after Class 12th for Commerce students, but first take a look at the most popular courses in Commerce stream offered after Class 12th.

Bachelor of Commerce or BCom is the most popular course for Commerce stream students, This course is majorly offered as BCom Honours and BCom General. In Commerce stream, while Accountancy, Business Studies and Economics are core subjects, Mathematics is optional. Thus, Commerce stream can be categorised into two groups: Commerce with Mathematics and without Mathematics. Students who studied Commerce with Mathematics in Class 11th and 12th can opt for BCom Honours while those who studied Commerce without Mathematics can opt for BCom General. 

There are many more options available to students who studied Commerce in Class 11th and 12th with Mathematics and those who studied Commerce without Mathematics. Take a look:

Commerce Courses: Highlights

Popular Courses
  • Certificate Course: Tally, Accounting, Accounting and Finance, Banking & Finance and others.
  • Diploma Course: Banking & Finance, Accounting and Finance, Computerised Accounting and others.
  • Undergraduate: B.com in General, Honours, Computer Applications, Accounting and Finance, Corporate Secretaryship, Banking and Insurance, Taxation, Cooperation
  • Postgraduate: M.Com in General, Finance, Computer Applications, Accounting and Finance, Accountancy, Marketing, Financial Management, Business Administration and many more.
  • Doctorate: PhD in Banking and Finance, Business Economics, Statistics, Commerce and Management, Accountancy, M.Phil In Commerce
Duration
  • Certificate Courses: 1 month to 2 Year 
  • Diploma Courses: 6 Months to 1 year
  • Undergraduate: 3 years
  • Postgraduate: 2 years
  • PhD in Commerce: 3 years to 6 Years, 2 years for MPhil
Eligibility
  • Certificate Courses: 12th Pass or Graduation from a recognized board.
  • Diploma Courses: 12th Pass or Graduation from a recognized board.
  • Undergraduate: Candidate should be 12th pass with a minimum of 45% in aggregate.
  • Postgraduate: Candidate should have 45%- 50% from graduation from a Commerce Stream from a Recognised Board.
  • Doctorate: Candidate should have completed a master’s degree or equivalent to that from a relevant discipline from a recognized university.
Average Fees
  • Certificate Courses: INR 7,000-20,000.
  • Diploma Courses: INR 15,000-30,000
  • Undergraduate: INR 25,000
  • Postgraduate: INR 60,000-1,20,000
  • Doctorate: INR 50,000-6,00,000
Types of Courses
  • Certificate Courses: Full-Time or Part-Time ( Regular)
  • Diploma Courses: Part-time or full time
  • Undergraduate: Regular (Full-Time) and Distance ( Full-Time)
  • Postgraduate: Full-Time (Regular and Distance)
  • Doctorate: Full-Time ( Regular and Distance)
Top Job Prospects
  • Certificate courses: Accountant Assistant, Investment Banker, Financial Controller etc.
  • Diploma Courses: Financial Analyst, Credit and Risk Manager, Loan Counsellor, Internal Auditor and many more.
  • Undergraduate: Accountant, Auditor, Consultant and many more.
  • Postgraduate: Accountant, Tax Consultant, Bank PO, Event Manager Lecturer, Chartered Accountant etc.
  • Doctorate: Teacher/ lecturer, Financial Manager, Statistician, Credit Control Manager, Consultant, Human Services worker, Scientist, Research Assistant etc.
Average Salary (Vary from department to departing and that of experience and expertise)
  • Certificate Courses: INR 2,00,000-4,00,000
  • Diploma Courses: INR 3,00,000-7,00,000
  • Undergraduate: INR 10,000-25,000 per month.
  • Postgraduate: INR 4,00,000-6,00,000
  • Doctorate: INR 1,80,000 to INR 6,00,000
